name: Fira Palace Barcelona

reviews.title: Quiet but very accessible Location
reviews.text: Really lovely hotel with very large bedrooms. Some on the higher floors have really nice views. We were initially on the 6th (top) floor but asked to be moved, as the entire floor 'resonates' with a constant hum from the air-conditioning. The sound nearly drove me mad ... however, it can't have been that bad, as my husband didn't even notice it!!

The hotel is in a good position, right at Montjuic and beside the MNAC. It is a very quiet location, there are a couple of nice restaurants nearby - but the main action is a taxi ride away.It was about a 20 minute pleasant stroll to the Ramblas.
reviews.title: Great Bathroom and Great Price

reviews.text: Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very good hotel but so-so restaurants
Fanastic Stay at the Fira
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel that is well worth the bang for your buck (We paid 99 Euros for 1 night). The shower area has multiple shower heads which made this stay worth it. The location is a bit isolated, especially with all the construction going on around the building but I would think this will clear up soon. A very comfortable room and a bit of a American feel, in terms of service and style.

We stayed at the Fira Palace for nearly a week. This hotel is extremely convenient to the convention center (the Fira), and close to a subway station. The rooms were very well appointed and large by European standards. The lobby and public spaces were large and elegant. Most of the staff spoke English, which was a plus for us. The biggest disappointment by far were the restaurants and bar. Breakfast featured a complete buffet which was OK. However the food at dinner in the restaurant was adequate at best. It featured local dishes, but the preparations were unexciting. In Barcelona, with its wonderful local cuisine, this was a big disappointment. On the other hand, the restaurant had a large selection of inexpensive but excellent Spanish wines. The bar off of the lobby was high priced and the staff was indifferent to the point of rudeness. Stay here for the rooms and location and skip the restaurant.
reviews.title: Fira Palace met my expectations

reviews.text: Fira Palace is excellently located very near Avenida Paral.lel, close to all major central Barcelona areas (plus a subway station is just few hundred meters away from hotel).
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, good location - gym & pool of poor standards

reviews.text: This hotel has some of the finest, best rooms I have seen in any hotel in Spain in its price range - rooms are large & spacious, well-lit, and marble bathrooms offer separate enclosures for toilet, bath and shower for added privacy.
reviews.title: Suprisingly Good!

reviews.text: All the hotel's amenities were very good - the only thing that stops me from giving this hotel full 5 stars is the gym/swimming pool - these facilities are NOT AT ALL on the same level of standards as the rest of the hotel!!! Swimming pool was dirty and delapitated, and gym was also like from early 70's.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Fully & highly recommend the hotel for those who do not care about the gym & pool (well, at least these facilities exists...).
reviews.title: A Perfect Vacation

reviews.text: I have just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona and we stayed at the Fira. The hotel staff were very accomadating and polite. We got to the hotel before check in times, but they were happy to keep our luggage in a store room whilst we wondered around the area.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — The price of the Internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights in Barcelona at the Fira Palace-what a lovely hotel! it's near the plaza de espana, not in the center of the city, but perfect for us because i liked to sleep in peace & quiet.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic time at the Fira Palace

likes.liked: — Beautiful room accommodation, bathroom, bedding & bed comfort
likes.disliked: — Breakfast was too expensive to include in our room rate booking, so we bought pastries the night before

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We signed up for the i prefer program before booking our hotel (through their website) and got free wi-fi in the room and a room upgrade just for signing up for hte program. definitely recommend signing up for the program & providing your account number when you book your room.
reviews.title: huge rooms

reviews.text: They gave us a corner suite with a balcony, and we only booked a standard room. it was fantastic. the shower had 2 body sprays, and a separate tub was nice. All the bathroom products you could ever need, along with a safe that was large enough for our laptop & other belongings.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Would defintely recommend the Fira Palace to anyone wishing to stay in Barcelona!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was quite a suite with king size bed, sofa, table and armchair. Huge LCD tv. Bathroom very large as well.
reviews.title: Quality hotel in good location

reviews.text: Coming from one night at the Barceo Sants, I can say the Fira Palace is infinately better: the rooms are quite large for Barcelona standards, the washrooms are huge. The staff at reception were very helpful in suggesting restaurants to us, which was no easy feat due to La Merce Festival that week (restaurants were either booked solid or closed for the holiday). The elevators did break down a couple of times while we were there (and the staff seemed lost in what to do), but other than that no complaints. Since I wasn't paying for the room there, I can't honestly comment on value. I do highly recommend a nearby restaurant - "Elche" at Vila i Vila 71 - excellent tapas and paella!
reviews.title: Anyone with a sense of taste avoid this

likes.liked: — That I was able to leave asap!
likes.disliked: — That I had to stay there!

reviews.text: I'm a frequent business traveller working with a Fortune 50 Company. Our corporation is notorious for selecting bad to terrible hotels for events and meetings. This rule was clearly confirmed this time. I stayed in the "Fear Palace" 3 nights and counted the minutes to leave. It clearly rates as one of the 10 worst hotels I stayed in (among 100's).
reviews.title: Good value but won't go back.

likes.liked: — Good value, very close to Palace/fountains etc
likes.disliked: — Impersonal atmosphere, bed configuration not quite suited to couple with a teenager

reviews.text: stayed at this hotel for 4 days with family room very clean and comfortable two large beds and a seating area, bathroom was clean marbled through out and well equipped with separate shower with body jets and a separate w/c and bidet.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel very well located as only 5 minutes from the Magic Fountains which are a must see but dont leave before they play "Barcelona by Freddie Merqury" as this is the finale, also very close to the Plaza Espanya where you can catch the metro (which is very easy to use) to anywhere in the city.
reviews.title: A Noisy Business Hotel With Bad Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: did not need to use the hotel staff apart from the check in and check out we arrived at 11.00 and was allowed to check in even though the check in was officially 15.00.
reviews.title: Up to expectations

reviews.text: Pool and gym very good we used the pool everyday and had it to ourselves.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: you can also request any type of pillow you like to make your stay more comfortable if need be.
reviews.title: Quiet nice place

reviews.text: win some lose some is the best way to sum this hotel up
reviews.title: win some lose some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms first class very spacious and superb bathroom the only problem was the lack of tea and coffee in the room a minor point for some people but for me important
reviews.title: OK but would not call it four star
Enjoyed my business stay
reviews.text: food only averege breakfast choice dissapointing for hot food choice
restaraunt food again nicely presented and served but not very inspiring
reviews.title: Very good value for money

likes.disliked: — Limited opening times of the gym

reviews.text: lesuire club just about ok but lift broken down so had to go up and down from reception to book in not happy about being asked to leave room key as deposit for the cap and towel
reviews.title: In Barcelona stay at the Fira Palace

reviews.text: I stayed in the Fira Palace for two nights at the end of March/start of April and have to say I was pleased overall. The hotel was only a short stroll to Plaza Espanya which is well connected to the rest of the city by metro and is also serviced by the tourist bus. We were well treated and on arrival the hotel were very helpful as we had to dart to a FC Barcelona game due to our delayed flight. The receptionist checked us in quickly and offered to take our bags direct to our room and order us a taxi to the ground. This was a great help. The pool in the morning was fine but I was a bit perturbed about the cleaner using pool water to clean the walkways around the pool by dipping her bucket into the water and then mopping around. Something didn't seem right about this!! Rooms were massive and bathrrom was excellent with bidets, power shower and separate room for toilet and for shower. However beds were very hard and I had a bad night's sleep due to this and some of the paper thin walls letting in noise. I didn't use the local restaurant as I felt 15euro per head for the buffet breakfast was a bit excessive. However the options outside of the hotel aren't great with basically one or two small (and expensive!) tapas bars available.
reviews.title: Well recommended

reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days in March, 2007, including attending a conference. The property is fairly well situated, as described in previous posts. It is possible to walk into the Barri Gothic, though you've got to want to walk - 40 minutes and not much to see. The room was huge, by European standards, and well appointed. Internet access (extra fee) was fine and the overall amenities were great. I considered sleeping on the floor, however, thinking it might be a little softer than the bed. Either I was too fatigued or got used to it - the last night I slept fine. Meeting arrangements were very good. Overall, an Ok place to stay.
reviews.title: Not a bad place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been for New Year's Eve 2007-2008 and we felt excellent! Services and personell are ok!
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Services

likes.liked: — A very generous and comfortable room

reviews.text: Breakfast not included for 145 Euro/Room. Accesss to swimming pool, sauna & gym granted in the same price.
reviews.title: Nice, clean and comfortable... but could have been better

likes.disliked: — No kettle and expensive extras (i.e. breakfast)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Roomy, excellent bath (shower cabine, toillete & bath - separated in the same bath by glass windows), flat LCD 32'' Sony TV included, wireless web access, etc.
reviews.title: Luxury Stay - The very best!

likes.liked: — Huge bedrooms, hydroshower, general luxury of the hotel!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel! Very quiet section of the city. 3 adults stayed in one room. The rooms were large and clean. The bathroom was huge also. The only downside is that this hotel is NOT centrally located. We live in NYC and walk everywhere and felt the hotel was NOT near any of the attractions. Be prepared to take the metro and or a taxi EVERYWHERE! The fountains (at night) are near the hotel and this is one attraction that is within a walking distance.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel....not centrally located.---at all!

reviews.text: The Hotel Fira Palace was all that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms were spacious, well equipped and cleaned daily. Heard no noise from outdoors or neighbouring rooms and good air conditioning. Friendly English speaking staff with excellent service within the bar and reception areas. Indoor pool and gym facilities of a high standard. Good location for the fountains (2 minute walk), Montjuic (behind the hotel) and Harbour, Ramblas etc (5 minutes by taxi costing 6-7 euros). One thing that was advertised at the time of booking - was complimentary coffee in reception. This was not the case as they only provided this for Delta airline staff! Overall though we were very satisfied with the hotel.
reviews.title: Good for Short Break

reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband and two year old daughter last week. Got a great deal going through the hotel's website--much better than any search/travel site. The rooms are HUGE and the bathrooms are immaculate. Easy walk to the Metro which takes you anywhere in the city. A little away from the main attractions but for us it was great as it was quieter than being near the nightlife. Staff very friendly. Separate bath and shower areas.
reviews.title: Great family hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed there because I have to attend a conference at this hotel. It is spacious, clean, staff is helpful and the room is equipped with wireless internet access. Breakfast is okay, the piano bar is nice too.
reviews.title: Spacious and Recommended for business travellers

reviews.text: It is some distance from the main shopping area, I needed to take 5-6 Euros taxi to get to De Glacia Street. Though it is quiet and comfortable.
reviews.title: Pretty good and enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good hotel, located close to some major Barcelona attractions.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good sized rooms and a hell of a bathroom (with bath and separate shower), they also offer a good and decent priced wireless access.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Not a great location if planning to really enjoy the club scene since you are a bit away from downtown Barcelona.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Excellent hotel even with kids
reviews.text: The Fira Palace is a nice hotel located directly next to the fair (which can be good and bad - especially when you are there 5 days before the int'l car show). It's in town, but we spent quite some money on taxis to go to various locations.
Rooms are really large, bed is hard (which I like), bathroom could be better organized (large but shower is small).
reviews.title: Disappointed with Fira

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights with my wife and two children and can highly recommend it. Kids under 12 stay free in parents' room and the bedrooms are vast.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Great bathroom, too, marble everywhere, and superb separate shower with powerful body jets.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Staff are friendly; on site car park that charges 16 euros per day.
reviews.title: Excellent! Don't bother looking anywhere else!

likes.liked: — Room size, amenities, low price for super quality

reviews.text: Hotel rates a bargain for this sort of hotel - it's officially four stars but could easily pass for five.
reviews.title: Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!

reviews.text: Breakfast extra, 15 euros for adults, half price for kids. But lovely little bakery across the road which has fresh croissants, pastries etc every morning if you want to save some euros.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel All Round

description: Enjoy the biggest rooms in the city at the elegant Fira Palace located in the heart of Montjuic, one of the most cultural and leisure area. Situated between the famous Plaza de España, Gran Via Avenue and the new shopping and entertainment centre ARENAS DE BARCELONA the hotel blends expert service to provide guests with a memorable stay. Highly popular among business travellers because of its conference facilities and easy acces to the Fair grounds.
